2:
--------------------
Text: Tempore:  The word is Latin, being the ablative singular of the noun "tempus, temporis", "time", thus meaning "in the time (of)".
Triplets:<Tempore
3: a name in the genitive case

--------------------
Text: Tempore:  It thus signifies the date range 1042–1066.
Triplets:<Tempore
7:
--------------------
Text: Tempore:  It is useful in historical literature because the names of many historical persons appear in surviving documents only in royal charters, possibly as witnesses, which can be dated to the reign of the originating monarch.
